FuncDef:
The nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command specifies an IP addresses to be locked and VPN instance information.
The function is disabled by default.
CLIs: nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address <lockip-address> [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] manual-unlock

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IP address to be locked in NAT defense.
The value is an IPv4 address in dotted decimal notation (X.X.X.X), for example, 10.1.1.1.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance in NAT defense.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If an IP address of NAT attack traffic is not locked, attack traffic keeps being sent to a NAT device, which adversely affects user traffic's bandwidth. To address this problem, run the nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command to manually lock an IP address so that a blackhole route to the IP address is generated and an interface board drops traffic destined for this IP address without sending the traffic to the NAT device.
Configuration Impact
After the nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command is run to lock an IP address and information about the user assigned this IP address is deleted, the IP address is no longer assigned to the other users and a blackhole route to this IP address is generated.
Precautions
The IP address to be manually locked must be a public IP address in a configured NAT address pool, not in a blacklist.
This command is mutually exclusive with the nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist auto-lock enable command.
The nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E.
